Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Aiming for a AED 32 trillion economy by 2033.While others catch up, Dubai builds ahead â€” setting the pace with clean, connected, scalable systems designed for 2040 and beyond.This is strategic city-building â€” and real leadership in motion.Grateful to witness it, and even more proud to contribute to it.Weâ€™re nearing 10,000 followers â€” and itâ€™s thanks to all of you.If this resonated, Iâ€™d appreciate you sharing my profile or this post with your network.Letâ€™s keep building a space for high-level insights, bold thinking, and real conversations.hashtag#Dubai2030 hashtag#SmartMobility hashtag#D33Agenda hashtag#UrbanExcellence hashtag#VisionDriven hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#FutureOfCities hashtag#RTA hashtag#LeadershipInAction hashtag#MobilityMatters

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Username: Diana Hamade Attorneys at LawDiana Hamade Attorneys at Law
Post Content:
Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Aiming for a AED 32 trillion economy by 2033.While others catch up, Dubai builds ahead â€” setting the pace with clean, connected, scalable systems designed for 2040 and beyond.This is strategic city-building â€” and real leadership in motion.Grateful to witness it, and even more proud to contribute to it.Weâ€™re nearing 10,000 followers â€” and itâ€™s thanks to all of you.If this resonated, Iâ€™d appreciate you sharing my profile or this post with your network.Letâ€™s keep building a space for high-level insights, bold thinking, and real conversations.hashtag#Dubai2030 hashtag#SmartMobility hashtag#D33Agenda hashtag#UrbanExcellence hashtag#VisionDriven hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#FutureOfCities hashtag#RTA hashtag#LeadershipInAction hashtag#MobilityMatters

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. This includes:âœ… KYC and AML due diligence â€“ not just box-ticking, but real risk and identity screening âœ… Conflict-of-interest checks â€“ because ethics matter as much as expertise âœ… Reputational and risk assessments â€“ who we represent says a lot about who we are âœ… Clearly defining scope and fees â€“ to avoid surprises down the road âœ… Formal engagement and internal approvals â€“ ensuring everything is by the bookOnboarding isn't just admin work â€” it's a key part of protecting both the firm and the client. If you're in the legal industry, or even just curious about what happens before a lawyer takes your case, I think you'll find it insightful.hashtag#KYC hashtag#Compliance hashtag#AML hashtag#Lawfirms hashtag#Dubai hashtag#ConflictCheck

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Equipping youth to become creators, regulators, and global innovators not passive tech consumers.Why the UAE Stands Alone GloballyWhere many advanced economies are still debating risks or running small-scale pilots, the UAE is:â†’ Institutionalizing AI literacy at scale.â†’ Building national, homegrown AI talent.â†’ Shaping international benchmarks for ethical, inclusive innovation.This aligns with the countryâ€™s boldest ambitions:1. UAE Centennial 2071 to be the best nation in the world by its centenary.2. Dubai Economic Agenda D33 to double the cityâ€™s economy in a decade.3. National Innovation Strategy with AI as a central pillar for growth.As HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum stated:â€œOur responsibility is to equip our children for a time unlike oursâ€¦ with new skills and capabilities to ensure the continued momentum of development and progress in our nation for decades to come.â€The UAE is not just preparing to participate in the global AI race it is setting the pace for the world to follow.

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Username: Diana Hamade Attorneys at LawDiana Hamade Attorneys at Law
Post Content:
Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Equipping youth to become creators, regulators, and global innovators not passive tech consumers.Why the UAE Stands Alone GloballyWhere many advanced economies are still debating risks or running small-scale pilots, the UAE is:â†’ Institutionalizing AI literacy at scale.â†’ Building national, homegrown AI talent.â†’ Shaping international benchmarks for ethical, inclusive innovation.This aligns with the countryâ€™s boldest ambitions:1. UAE Centennial 2071 to be the best nation in the world by its centenary.2. Dubai Economic Agenda D33 to double the cityâ€™s economy in a decade.3. National Innovation Strategy with AI as a central pillar for growth.As HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum stated:â€œOur responsibility is to equip our children for a time unlike oursâ€¦ with new skills and capabilities to ensure the continued momentum of development and progress in our nation for decades to come.â€The UAE is not just preparing to participate in the global AI race it is setting the pace for the world to follow.

Aiming for a AED 32 trillion economy by 2033.While others catch up, Dubai builds ahead â€” setting the pace with clean, connected, scalable systems designed for 2040 and beyond.This is strategic city-building â€” and real leadership in motion.Grateful to witness it, and even more proud to contribute to it.Weâ€™re nearing 10,000 followers â€” and itâ€™s thanks to all of you.If this resonated, Iâ€™d appreciate you sharing my profile or this post with your network.Letâ€™s keep building a space for high-level insights, bold thinking, and real conversations.hashtag#Dubai2030 hashtag#SmartMobility hashtag#D33Agenda hashtag#UrbanExcellence hashtag#VisionDriven hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#FutureOfCities hashtag#RTA hashtag#LeadershipInAction hashtag#MobilityMatters

You exit.In Dubai, the smartest investors?Theyâ€™re exiting before handover.Because in well-zoned, well-timed off-plan projects â€”value isnâ€™t created at completion.Itâ€™s created during construction.Hereâ€™s how:â€¢ ğŸ“ˆ 15%â€“35% Value Uplift Pre-HandoverTop-tier off-plan projects have seen capital appreciation from launch to handover ranging between 15%â€“35% â€” especially in low-density branded or community-based offerings.â€¢ â³ Exit Timeline: 14â€“28 MonthsInvestors are flipping during construction or just before handover â€” without ever furnishing or renting.Itâ€™s velocity, not holding, that defines this bracket.â€¢ ğŸ§­ Supply Timing = ROI AccelerationThe sweet spot? Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting
