Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Early phases in areas where infrastructure is 90% complete, but sentiment is still 60% priced in.â€¢ ğŸ—ï¸ Developer Credibility = Exit PremiumsProjects from developers with clear delivery records + resale support ecosystems =Higher resale volume, faster assignments, and better buyer trust.â€¢ ğŸ”’ Limited Supply, Locked-in PricingIn a market where new launches keep inflating, locked-in early bird pricing becomes its own asset.Investors are monetizing access, not just appreciation.Growiieze Final Thought:Dubaiâ€™s best real estate returns arenâ€™t always made after handover.Theyâ€™re made between the brochure and the balcony.Because when timing, product, and zone align â€”capital moves before the cranes stop.hashtag#GrowiiezePerspective hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#SmartInvestinghashtag#OffPlanReturns hashtag#CapitalVelocity hashtag#HNIStrategyhashtag#ROIInsights hashtag#BuiltWithPurpose hashtag#RealEstateLogichashtag#InvestorLens hashtag#Dubai2025 hashtag#AssetStackinghashtag#ExitBeforeHandover hashtag#GlobalCapitalFlow hashtag#GrowiiezeInsightshashtag#MiddleEastGrowth hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#Dubai

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Equipping youth to become creators, regulators, and global innovators not passive tech consumers.Why the UAE Stands Alone GloballyWhere many advanced economies are still debating risks or running small-scale pilots, the UAE is:â†’ Institutionalizing AI literacy at scale.â†’ Building national, homegrown AI talent.â†’ Shaping international benchmarks for ethical, inclusive innovation.This aligns with the countryâ€™s boldest ambitions:1. UAE Centennial 2071 to be the best nation in the world by its centenary.2. Dubai Economic Agenda D33 to double the cityâ€™s economy in a decade.3. National Innovation Strategy with AI as a central pillar for growth.As HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum stated:â€œOur responsibility is to equip our children for a time unlike oursâ€¦ with new skills and capabilities to ensure the continued momentum of development and progress in our nation for decades to come.â€The UAE is not just preparing to participate in the global AI race it is setting the pace for the world to follow.

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Hello, just prepared some notes for my Ethiopian Fellows who are looking for opportunities in UAE.This is just from my personal experience, not a professional guide but one common question I get is: â€œShould I come to Dubai to find a job or apply from Ethiopia?"Both options work. If you get hired from Ethiopia, your employer will process your employment visa which is ideal. But most interviews in Dubai happen face-to-face, so being here increases your chances of getting hired faster.The other thing to consider is looking for an intern or entryâ€‘level hire as many Dubai companies will sponsor your work permit even if you have no local experience, and internships often convert into fullâ€‘time roles compared to mid-senior to senior positions as most of the companies require UAE experience. I highly suggest you to be active on LinkedIn, follow companies with the industry that aligns to you and message HR staff as the connection you build is highly valuable, even if you might not get a fast result in the long term it will highly benefits you in your career advancement.Make sure your cv is tailored and ATS friendly based on the job description and prepare a cover letter for each application (See this guide written by GulfTalent on how to prepare your cv https://lnkd.in/dyDituwF ).One important thing to keep in mind is the job market is competitive so it's better to have strong technical skills and Prepare a portfolio of your past work or projects. This helps you stand out and gives employers something concrete to review during interviews.Try to do a research about things like: Cost of living, Visa process and Company reputation once you start getting offers. Just a reminder NEVER PAY anyone that says "we will provide you the job but you have pay for admin fee, visa fee or any other form of payment.These are sites commonly used for the job search here beyond the company portal:- https://www.linkedin.com/- https://ae.indeed.com/ - https://lnkd.in/d2D-PXAd- https://lnkd.in/drzMFAvz- https://lnkd.in/dQZuhvnyBeyond the above job portals focus on the company's portal as well as some applications require a detailed application process, they upload it on their career page.Hope this helps someone out there maybe I will add some additional guide. Feel free to share, comment, or message me if you have questions and I will try to answer them.

Our 4th episode of hashtag#Psych_Legal_Talk is out to be shared with you, if you have an interest in the subject of the divorce of Muslims in the UAE, applying UAE Federal Decree Law 41 of 2024on Personal Status matters.We discuss how Sharia allows a man to pronounce his No-Fault Divorce, his Talaq, and a woman to file for divorce or Khula, while the UAE Non Muslims Laws allow women and men the same right of No Fault Divorce, and grants compensation payable by the party who has caused the end of the marriage.Muslims Law is unfortunately void of any mention of compensation to be paid to the party who has suffered harm by the other party, allowing divorce without any  reprecussions. Dubai's population boom is creating unprecedented real estate opportunities for investors. In the first quarter of 2025 alone, the city welcomed nearly 90,000 new residents, equating to almost 1,000 individuals daily. This surge in population isn't merely a statistic; it's a clear indicator of escalating demand for housing, infrastructure, and commercial properties that surpasses all expectations.For investors, this surge signifies an ideal moment to establish a presence in a market where various sectors are experiencing remarkable growth:- Apartment prices have risen by 20% year-on-year- Villa prices have seen a significant surge of 29%- Office rents have escalated by over 20%- Residential rents are steadily increasingAlthough there is an anticipated influx of over 61,000 new units in 2025, the existing demand levels suggest that this supply may not be adequate to rebalance the market dynamics. For those with a long-term investment perspective, it's crucial to note that Dubai is not just attracting residents but also talent, capital, and businesses. The rapid population growth forms the cornerstone of real estate value, and in Dubai, this growth is occurring at an unprecedented pace.If you are considering transforming these statistics into profitable returns, let's engage in a conversation. Our team is on-site and prepared to provide you with expert guidance on seizing the opportunities presented by Dubai's thriving real estate market.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#UAEGrowth hashtag#HiveNetwork hashtag#InvestorInsight hashtag#RealEstate2025 hashtag#PopulationBoom hashtag#SmartInvesting

Step into Dubai's Future: Unpacking the Vision 2040 Urban Master Plan âœ¨Dubai isn't just building for tomorrow; it's meticulously crafting a better tomorrow. The Dubai 2040 Urban Master Plan isn't merely about expansion; it's a visionary blueprint centred entirely on enhancing the quality of life for everyone.Imagine a city designed around you. That's the heart of Vision 2040.Simplified, itâ€™s about making Dubai the world's best city to live in by focusing on: * People & Well-being: Prioritizing residents' happiness and health. Think integrated communities where 80% of daily needs (work, shops, health, education, leisure) are accessible within a 20-minute sustainable journey (walk, cycle, transit). * Nature & Sustainability: Doubling green and recreational areas! Parks, nature reserves, and public beaches become even more integral, weaving a green lung through the urban landscape. Sustainability isn't an afterthought; it's the foundation. * Vibrant, Focused Growth: Developing distinct urban centres. Areas like Deira/Bur Dubai (heritage), Downtown/Business Bay (financial hub), Marina/JBR (tourism/entertainment), Expo 2020 Centre (events/logistics), and Silicon Oasis (knowledge/innovation) will be further enhanced. Plus, a special focus on developing the unique potential of areas like Hatta. * Economic Dynamism: Reinforcing Dubai's position as a global economic powerhouse by attracting diverse talent and investment into dynamic, future-focused sectors. * Heritage & Identity: While forging ahead, the plan ensures the preservation and celebration of Dubai's rich Emirati heritage and cultural identity.Vision 2040 represents a profound shift from rapid growth to smart, sustainable, human-centric development. Itâ€™s about creating a harmonious balance between urban life, nature, opportunity, and cultural roots. Itâ€™s less about building more, and more about building better, creating spaces where people truly thrive.This isn't just urban planning; it's a promise of a dynamic, resilient, inclusive, and enchanting future for Dubai. A compelling glimpse into what a people-first global city can look like! ğŸš€hashtag#Dubai2040 hashtag#UrbanPlanning hashtag#FutureCities hashtag#Sustainability hashtag#QualityOfLife hashtag#SmartCity hashtag#Dubai hashtag#UAE hashtag#Vision hashtag#Innovation hashtag#PeopleFirst

The SouthMED Egypt campaign by Talaat Moustafa Group (TMG) is a powerful example of how strategic marketing and creative excellence can transform a real estate launch into a global phenomenon.Key Highlights: â€¢	Celebrity Endorsement: Featuring Hollywood icon Sylvester Stallone, and iconic football player Thierry Henry. the campaign instantly gained international credibility and attention, elevating SouthMED beyond a typical property launch. â€¢	Engaging Storytelling: The use of humor and relatable narratives created emotional resonance, driving urgency and memorability. â€¢	Record-Breaking Sales: Phase 1 sold out rapidly, generating approximately (~$1.25 billion). International Positioning: Campaign designed to compete with top Mediterranean destinations, attracting foreign buyers and tourists â€¢	Targeted Audience Reach: Successfully appeals to luxury buyers, high-net-worth individuals, and international investors, especially from GCC and Europe â€¢	Viral Reach: Millions of views across digital platforms amplified brand awareness locally and internationally. â€¢	Luxury & Lifestyle Positioning: SouthMED offers unmatched amenities, including the largest private marina in the Mediterranean, an 18-hole golf course, and over 2,000 hotel rooms-positioning it as a premier Mediterranean destination. â€¢	Sustainability & Innovation: The development integrates smart city technologies and eco-friendly solutions, aligning with global sustainability trends and Egyptâ€™s Vision 2030. â€¢	Economic Impact: Projected to create 1.6 million jobs and significantly boost Egyptâ€™s GDP and tourism sector.This campaign masterfully combines celebrity influence, aspirational storytelling, and clear market positioning to create urgency and trust. For marketers and developers alike, SouthMED stands as a benchmark in leveraging creative strategy to drive both brand equity and commercial success.hashtag#MarketingStrategy hashtag#CreativeExcellence hashtag#CelebrityEndorsement hashtag#RealEstateMarketing hashtag#TMG hashtag#Sustainability hashtag#EgyptRealEstate
